ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I strengthened my writing skills, especially improving my structure and concision. Analyzed time travel from multiple points of view, especially a historical one as well as the typical sci-fi tropes. Many discussions on the loose definition of time travel. Also improved my researching ability and finding sources.

Time travel is more than science fiction. It is a concept that draws from authenticity, whiteness, fiction, euro centricity, drama, race, etc. Truly a fascinating course that proved to me that a topic could be much more than what we initially think it means.

Through our discussion of time travel, I learned a lot about how the past, present, and future are framed in the media and academic works. This course conducts a thorough study of concepts relating to historiography before looking at different historical fiction and science fiction works. This organization prepares you to critically examine different stories, movies, and TV shows. My writing improved throughout the course as I was able to practice writing different styles of academic papers.

I became a better writer and am more able to recognize faults in my writing. I learned that time travel is more complex than I thought it was such as the different biases within time travel media not only towards race but modernity as well.
Made my writing more sophisticated, and learned to break out of the old formulaic writing I learned in high school.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: specific feedback and workshops, flexible on adjusting reading assignments, writing tutor extension, engaging discussions
Weaknesses: time travel focused a lot on analyzing historical perspectives, not exactly what I was expecting, essay feedback took a long time to get back to us

Being an ENGL 114 seminar, this course allowed me to develop and grow my writing. From close reading to a research paper, I was able to see my writing improve through multiple drafts, feedback from fellow peers and the instructor, and incredible techniques taught in class.
The course is interesting and the readings are pretty engaging. You receive a lot of help when drafting the papers which aids you in getting a good grade.
A strength is that it taught me more analyzing time travel media for bias. It could be improved by having a stronger connection to time travel in the beginning of the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, it was really interesting and although not what I was expecting much more interesting than a typical high school english class. A lovely transition into college writing and I feel like I really improved throughout.
Especially for first years, yes. This course will allow you to improve your writing, a skill much needed.

Yes. It is a good course to improve your writing at the start of college. You practice writing many different types of papers, are aided in the process, and get clear feedback. The workload is not very high compared to other classes and the topics covered are pretty interesting.
I would recommend this course to a student who is interested in bias and how it can show up within different genres. Also a someone who wants to broaden the scope of what they think time travel is.
Absolutely! I avoided taking a writing credit because I hated it in high school, but I really regret not taking ENGL 114 freshman year
